intro: [WRONG START] Obernna behen, commonly known as the Indian bael tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its large, elongated leaves and fragrant white flowers. The tree produces a heavy, spiny fruit that contains a single large, edible seed encased in a fibrous pulp. The bark and leaves of Oberna behen are also used in traditional medicine for their various therapeutic properties. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
